channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13004] Make possible to explain why HBaseTestingUtility.waitFor fails
item.description:
HBaseTestingUtility has good methods for waiting conditions, but with one drawback, when waitfor fails, there is no way to explain what happened (fail() called from internals and that is not very easy to intercept and explain state of failure).

That would be great to have enhanced Predicate which can explain state after it failed to wait for.

That can looks like


HBaseTestingUtility.waitFor(10000, new ExplainingPredicate() {

   boolean evaluate() {

     ... some evaluation code

   }

   String explain() {

    ... generate brief explanation of what to be expected, but not happened

   }

}
item.summary: Make possible to explain why HBaseTestingUtility.waitFor fails

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Added ExplainingPredicate to Waiter
Added explainTableAvailability to explain why table possibly was not available (act as example of usage of EP)

lgtm
minor comments:


109	     * @return the boolean result of the evaluation.

110	     */

111	    String explainFailure() throws E;

Please update @return description.


2928	    List<Pair<HRegionInfo, ServerName>> metaLocations =

2929	        MetaTableAccessor.getTableRegionsAndLocations(connection, tableName);

2930	    if (getHBaseCluster().getMaster().isAlive()) {

metaLocations can be assigned inside the if block where it is used.
thank you Ted Yu for reviewing and suggestions.
fixed minor issues

Integrated to master branch.

There is rejected hunks in HBaseTestingUtility.java applying to branch-1.

@Andrey:
Mind attaching patch for branch-1 ?

Thanks
Ted Yu, seems a bit different code. I'll make branch-1 patch.

branch-1 has different state management (branch 2 keeps it in meta). that is why patch fails.
attached adapted for branch-1 patch
oops, branch 2 keeps state in descriptors (but that will change soon)
